newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Landmine blast kills seven Sri Lankan soldiers.
newsitem.headline: Landmine blast kills seven Sri Lankan soldiers.

text.p: Seven Sri Lankan soldiers were killed by a suspected Tamil Tiger rebel landmine in the northern Jaffna peninsula on Thursday, military officials said.
The soldiers were in a vehicle when it was blown up by the mine near Nagarkovil, on the east coast of the peninsula, 320 km (200 miles) north of the capital Colombo, they said.
The Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) rebels are fighting for an independent homeland for minority Tamils in the Indian Ocean island's north and east.
The government says more than 50,000 people have died in the war, now in its 14th year. The LTTE say the number is higher.
The LTTE spokesman was not immediately available for comment.
